intro: Cordula victoria-mariae, commonly known as the Victoria-Mariae cordula, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in rainforests or near water sources.
